intro: Packera subnuda var. subnuda, commonly known as the nakedleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Packera subnuda var. subnuda is a perennial herb that is often found in the western United States.
